page.title: 12Flora and Fauna
page.content: I live in Marple, a village in the district of Stockport. Marple is a peaceful place really, not at all that busy, you would not expect to find a lot of Nature, but you do. In my garden every winter a little grey squirrel and it's family come and eat the nuts off the tree. In summer there are lots of different wild flowers and grasses, such as rye grass, and timothy grass which has a soft furry bit at the top. Some of wild flowers are red ones called poppies, yellow ones called buttercups and lots of others. There are lots of animals such as cows, horses, sheep, pigs and rabbits. There are birds such as Robins, Blue Tits, Starlings and Sparrows. Insects are numerous too. There are Beetles, Butterflies and Spiders.
